comments:
I searched and didn't find a comparable bug.

When I use code folding, if I collapse the last foldable unit in the editor
(whatever the last expanded arrow is), I get this error (I apologize for the
length) - this has been true for every release since it came out, which confuses
me as to why I couldn't find a bug for it yet - my release information is:
eclipse.buildId=I200405140800
- Here is the error -

I just noticed a few things.

1.) The error only occurs if the method overrides/implements another (superclass
or interface).
2.) the EXACT same thing happens if I click the 'overrides button' right next to
the collapse/expand fold button.
3.) The error appears in the superclass/interface editor window that opened.
4.) If I go back to the editor window the code has correctly folded, but the
error window opening for the interface totally threw me off balance.

The class in question is implementing the method Comparator.compare(...) - and
when it throws an error I get this wierd result (I will attach a snapshot)

The most interesting thing is that it appears clicks on the final code fold in
the editor are incorrectly being considered override lookups.

I'll attach a snapshot.

I have spent a lot more time working with this, and it turns out it ALWAYS
occurs when there is an override icon next to a folding icon. When I click the
folding control, both controls are activated. Sometimes the override control
fails - but I think that is a seperate issue.

I am not 100% sure why, but mouse clicks on the folding control also register on
the override control...
Is it possible that you use a 1.5 level VM?
*** Bug 72394 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Works for me using R3.1. If you still see this using R3.1 or newer then please
reopen and provide steps to reproduce.
